trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Burleson
There were no other sightings in Burleson on or around December 10th 2009
divs: sighting detailsi noticed odd lights in the sky. i observed them for only about 5 minutes in all. maybe less. they could have been there much longer, i don't know. they were blinking quickly (not all would blink at once) amongst themselves in a predictable, synchronized pattern. they were stationary (in a group) for about 4 minutes and then softly moved off and disappeared. my daughter and i both witnessed this. the lights were small as stars, colored whitish\blue as stars. the lower level planes that were also in the sky seemed artificial and yellow compared to these ufo lights. the planes were definitely lower and definitely planes. these synchronized lights were something totally different. i have never seen anything like this ever! i live in a semirural area that is surrounded by urban sprawl. we have some light pollution and lots of plane traffic due to the airports around the dfw area, but we can see the stars too at times. the only reason that these lights even caught my eye in the first place was the quick, rapid firing of the light sequence. otherwise i may have not seen it. i don't know why i looked up in the sky, but i was out in the barn feeding my animals and my horse nudged my face. she doesn't do this ordinarily and she did it twice tonight! i just happened to look up at that second time that she nudged me and this light pattern caught my eye. the lights moved off in their organized pattern and kept the "light sequence pattern" going as they gradually left the sky. they faded off in the distance slowly but they were gone in @ 30 seconds from the time that they began to move. the departure was gradual, but quick. i think that there were about 3 lights on one horizontal level, the end craft "blinked" diagonally upwards to another level, and then another level began to blink. perhaps there were 6 in all? they seemed to be in a "stair step" pattern. my daughter attempted to catch them on her cell phone but she did not get any good footage.
Summary: 6 -9 individual star-like lights that would "communicate" in a repetive sychronized pattern
